bases.name: The Homeworld
bases.description: After each time a minion is played here, its owner may play an extra minion of power 2 or less

bases.name: The Mothership
bases.description: After this base scores, the winner may return one of his or her minions of power 3 or less to his or her hand

bases.name: Tar Pits
bases.description: After each time a minion is destroyed here, place it at the bottom of its owner's deck

bases.name: Ninja Dojo
bases.description: After this base scores, the winner may destroy any one minion

bases.name: Temple of Goju
bases.description: After this base scores, place each player's highest power minion here on the bottom of its owner's deck

bases.name: The Grey Opal
bases.description: After this base scores, all players other than the winner may move a minion from here to another base instead of the discard pile

bases.name: Tortuga
bases.description: The runner up may move one of his or her minions to the base that replaces this base

bases.name: Factory 436-1337
bases.description: When this base scores, the winner gains 1 VP for every 5 power that player has here

bases.name: The Central Brain
bases.description: Each minion here has +1 power

bases.name: Cave of Shinies
bases.description: After each time a minion is destroyed here, its owner gains 1 VP

bases.name: Mushroom Kingdom
bases.description: At the start of each player's turn, that player may move one other player's minion from any base to here

bases.name: School of Wizardry
bases.description: After this base scores, the winner looks at the top 3 cards of the base deck, chooses one to replace this base, and returns the others in any order

bases.name: The Great Library
bases.description: After this base scores, all players with minions here may draw one card

bases.name: Evans City Cemetery
bases.description: After this base scores, the winner discards his or her hand and draws five cards

bases.name: Rhodes Plaza Mall
bases.description: When this base scores, each player gains 1 VP for each minion that player has here

bases.name: Field of Honor
bases.description: When one or more minions here are destroyed, the player who destroyed them gains 1 VP

bases.name: Tsar's Palace
bases.description: Minions of power 2 or less cannot be played here

bases.name: Haunted House
bases.description: After a player plays a minion here, that player must discard a card

bases.name: The Dread Gazebo
bases.description: Players cannot play actions on this base

bases.name: Secret Grove
bases.description: On your turn, you may play one extra minion of power 2 or less here

bases.name: The Greenhouse
bases.description: The winner may search his or her deck for a minion and play it on the base that replaces this one

bases.name: Inventor's Salon
bases.description: The winner may take an action from his or her discard pile and place it in his or her hand

bases.name: Workshop
bases.description: When a player plays an action card on this base, that player may play an extra action

bases.name: Monkey Lab
bases.description: Minions here get +1 power for each action played on them

bases.name: Primate Park
bases.description: The winner may place his or her actions played on minions here back into his or her hand

bases.name: Faceless City
bases.description: Once per turn, after you play a minion here, search your deck for a copy of that minion, reveal it, and place it into your hand. Shuffle your deck

bases.name: The Vats
bases.description: You may not play a minion here that has the same name as another minion here

bases.name: ISI's Swingin' Pad
bases.description: The winner may look at the top three cards of his or her deck and return them in any order

bases.name: Secret Volcano Headquarters
bases.description: Before this base scores, all players reveal the top card of their decks. Play all revealed minions here

bases.name: Portal Room
bases.description: The winner takes an extra turn after the current turn ends

bases.name: The Nexus
bases.description: The winner replaces this base with a base of his or her choice from the base discard pile, if possible

bases.name: Egg Chamber
bases.description: Minions here with +1 power counters cannot be destroyed

bases.name: The Hill
bases.description: At the start of each player's turn, that player may move one of his or her minions from any base to here

bases.name: Golem Schlo√ü
bases.description: The winner places a +1 power counter on each of his or her minions

bases.name: Laboratorium
bases.description: The first minion played here each turn gets a +1 power counter

bases.name: Castle Blood
bases.description: After you play a minion here, if another player has more power here than you do, you may place a +1 power counter on that minion

bases.name: Crypt
bases.description: When one or more minions here are destroyed the player who destroyed them may place a +1 power counter on one of his or her minions here

bases.name: Moot Site
bases.description: The first minion played here each turn gains +2 power until the end of the turn

bases.name: Standing Stones
bases.description: During your turn, one of your minions here can use its Talent twice

bases.name: TableTop
bases.description: The winner draws 3 cards, then discards 2 cards

bases.name: The Con
bases.description: When a minion is played here, other minions here of that faction gain +1 power until the end of the turn

bases.name: Enchanted Glen
bases.description: After you play an action on a minion here, draw a card

bases.name: Fairy Circle
bases.description: After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may play an extra minion here or play an extra action

bases.name: The House of Nine Lives
bases.description: If a minion at another base would be destroyed, its owner may move it here instead

bases.name: Cool Cats' Alley
bases.description: Once during your turn, you may destroy one of your minions here to draw a card

bases.name: Equaria
bases.description: After you play a minion here, you may move one of your minions from another base to here

bases.name: Pony Land
bases.description: If you have two or more minions here, your minions here cannot be destroyed

bases.name: Beautiful Castle
bases.description: Minions here with power 5 or greater are not affected by opponents' cards

bases.name: Ice Castle
bases.description: Minions cannot be played here

bases.name: Dragon's Lair
bases.description: The winner draws 3 cards

bases.name: Wyrm's Desolation
bases.description: Each minion here has -1 power

bases.name: Oracle at Delphi
bases.description: After you play a minion here, reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an action, draw it; otherwise return it

bases.name: Wooden Horse
bases.description: After any player plays an action, he or she may give a minion here +2 power until the end of the turn

bases.name: Shark Reef
bases.description: After a minion is destroyed here, the player that destroyed it may place a +1 power counter on one of their minions

bases.name: The Deep
bases.description: After you play a minion of power 4 or more here, you may destroy a minion with less power here

bases.name: Converted Cave
bases.description: Minions of power 2 or less cannot be destroyed here except by their controller

bases.name: Crystal Fortress
bases.description: After you play a minion here, you may place a minion from your discard pile on the bottom of your deck

bases.name: Tornado Alley
bases.description: After the first time you play a minion here each turn, you may move another minion to here from another base

bases.name: Trailer Park
bases.description: After you move a minion to here, place a +1 power counter on it

bases.name: Neutral Space
bases.description: Minions here are not affected by other players' minions here

bases.name: USS Undertaking
bases.description: At the start of your turn, you may move one of your minions to here, or from here to another base

bases.name: Changing Room
bases.description: After a minion here uses a talent, it gains +1 power until the end of the turn

bases.name: Unicrave
bases.description: Before this base scores, replace it with the top card of the base deck. Keep all cards on it, discard this card, and keep scoring

bases.name: No-Moon
bases.description: Before this base scores, place a random other base and all cards on it in the discard pile. Replace it with the top card of the base deck

bases.name: Hive of Scum and Villainy
bases.description: After the first time each turn that you play an action that directly increases the power of one of your minions here, draw a card

bases.name: Wintersquashed
bases.description: After you play a minion here, you may give control of it to another player

bases.name: Spikey Chair Room
bases.description: At the end of any turn that a player has played at least one minion here, they may destroy a minion they own to draw a card
